It‚Äôs not every day you get to see a black hole for the first time! Astronomers have finally captured an image of the elusive space phenomenon. The image reveals the black hole at the centre of Messier 87, an enormous galaxy in the nearby Virgo galaxy cluster. This black hole resides 55 million light-years from Earth and has a mass roughly 6.5-billion times that of the Sun! Avery Broderick, a physicist at the University of Waterloo, helped interpret the image. He had also previously developed theoretical models that accurately predicted what images of a black hole would look like. Learn more: http://ow.ly/XUno30ooMGO #CdnScience

Cold-water corals have attracted significant scientific and conservation interest in recent years. Approximately 25 to 30 coral species live in waters off Atlantic Canada. And there are also 34 identified species of sponge in these waters. Some, such as Vazella pourtalesi, form complex, three-dimensional biogenic structures on the sea floor that are believed to influence the occurrence and abundance of other invertebrates and fish. Fish use them for feeding, reproduction and resting. Learn more about cold-water corals and sponges: http://ow.ly/mB7G50vyjja Fisheries and Oceans Canada
